Resolution commemorating the 350th Anniversary of the Flushing Remonstrance in the City of New York.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Commemorating the 350th Anniversary of the Flushing Remonstrance in NYC.

Items.Title: Resolution declaring November to be New York City History Month.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Declaring November to be New York City History Month.

Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: State Legislature to amend the Public Authorities Law in relation to siting requirements for the NYC School Construction Authority’s Leasing Program.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the State Legislature to amend the Hudson River Park Act to authorize a marine transfer station and environmental education center in the Gansevoort peninsula in lower Manhattan.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

The following 3 Council Members formally voted against this item: 
Council Members Brewer, Garodnick, and Lappin.

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: State Legislature to amend the Hudson River Park Act to authorize a marine transfer station and environmental education center in the Gansevoort peninsula in lower Manhattan.

Introduction & Reading of Bills

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to increasing the credit against the city personal income tax on residents for such residents' share of city unincorporated business tax paid by partnerships in which such residents are partners or businesses of which such residents are proprietors.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Increasing the credit against the city personal income tax on residents for such residents’ share of city unincorporated business tax paid by partnerships in which such residents are partners or businesses of which such residents are proprietors.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.5375-A, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.7213-A, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to allowing members of the police department to remain in service until age 65”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Allowing members of the police department to remain in service until age 65 (S.5375-A, A.7213-A).

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Padavan, S.6247, and Assembly Member Farrell, A.8264-A, “AN ACT to amend the tax law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to authorizing a credit against the city personal income tax on residents for such residents’ share of city general corporation tax and banking corporation tax paid by subchapter S corporations in which such residents are shareholders for taxable years beginning on or after January 1, 2007”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Personal income tax on residents.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Maltese, Lanza and Padavan, S.6009-B, and Assembly Member Farrell, A.8275-B, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to increasing the deduction for compensation of partners and proprietors under the unincorporated business tax; in relation to decreasing the alternative income plus compensation base under the general corporation tax; in relation to eliminating the alternative tax on income plus compensation and the tax on capital and simplifying tax return filing under the general corporation tax for certain taxpayers with gross income less than two hundred fifty thousand dollars; and in relation to revising the unincorporated business tax paid credit”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Revising the unincorporated business tax.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on State and Federal Legislation

State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Maltese, Lanza and Padavan, S.6009-B, and Assembly Member Farrell, A.8275-B, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to increasing the deduction for compensation of partners and proprietors under the unincorporated business tax; in relation to decreasing the alternative income plus compensation base under the general corporation tax; in relation to eliminating the alternative tax on income plus compensation and the tax on capital and simplifying tax return filing under the general corporation tax for certain taxpayers with gross income less than two hundred fifty thousand dollars; and in relation to revising the unincorporated business tax paid credit”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Revising the unincorporated business tax.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Padavan, S.6247, and Assembly Member Farrell, A.8264-A, “AN ACT to amend the tax law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to authorizing a credit against the city personal income tax on residents for such residents’ share of city general corporation tax and banking corporation tax paid by subchapter S corporations in which such residents are shareholders for taxable years beginning on or after January 1, 2007”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Personal income tax on residents.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member Perry, A.3963, “AN ACT to amend the New York city charter, the vehicle and traffic law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the “open driveway act” regarding the environmental control board adjudication of disputes concerning the blocking of a driveway; and providing for the repeal of such provisions upon expiration thereof”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Open Driveway Act

(RESOLUTION B)

Items.MatterName: Landmark, Laboratory Administration Building, Brooklyn Botanic Garden, Brooklyn (20075343HKK)

Items.Title: Uniform land use review procedure application no. C 070235 ZMM, pursuant to Sections197-c and 201 of the New York City Charter for an amendment of the Zoning Map, Section 6b, changing an R7-2 District to a M1-1 District.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Application be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, East Harlem Salt Storage Facility, Manhattan (C070235ZMM)

Items.Title: Uniform land use review procedure application no. C 070236 PSM, pursuant to Sections 197-c of the Charter of the City of New York for site selection of property located at 2590 First Avenue, Manhattan, Council District 8 for use as a salt storage facility.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Application be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, 2590 First Avenue, Manhattan, Council District 8 (C070236PSM)

Items.Title: Application no. 20075545 SCQ  pursuant to Section 1732 of the New York School Construction Authority Act, concerning the proposed site selection for a new 800-seat intermediate/high school building for the Queens Gateway to Health Sciences Secondary School, located on the grounds of Queens Hospital Center, south side of Goethals Avenue between 160th and 162nd Streets (Block 6858, Lot 1 in portion), in Council District 24.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Application be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: School Construction, Queens Gateway to Health Sciences Secondary School, Queens (20075545SCQ)

Items.Title: Passed The Consent Agenda
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that these files be approved by consent vote.

Items.MinutesNote: The Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

The following files were removed from the General Order Calendar and voted separately:

M-655 and
M-656 & Res No. 913

See files for individual votes.

At this point, the Speaker (Council Member Quinn) asked for a Moment of Slence for the following individual:

Army Sgt. Kimel Watt, 21, of East New York, Brooklyn who died on June 3, 2007 of wounds suffered when an improvised explosive device detonated near his vehicle.  He was assigned to the 1st Battalion, 7th Field Artillery Regiment based in Germany.  Sgt. Watt is survived by his father Clifton, mother Naomi, 2 sisters, and 3 brothers.
